result.execSummary:
The defendant Damont DeAndre Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damont DeAndre Green

records.addlTxt: 9:31 AM Defendant Damont DeAndre Green in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Damont DeAndre Green.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads no contest to count two. Court finds the defendant guilty. Court orders 90 days Jail-Time served. Court costs due December 16 2022. Count one is dismissed and read in. 180 days Credit. Court approves the modification of costs to zero with sentence credit. Bond to be returned.
Calendar call on October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

2:21 PM Defendant Damont DeAndre Green in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy by video. Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set, bond to continue.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance

Preliminary hearing requested within time limits and by zoom.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
